t: John 1
The Eternal Word
In*p the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
He was in the beginning with God.
All things were made through Him, and without Him nothing was made that was made.
In Him was life, and the life was the light of men.
And the light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not comprehend it.
John’s Witness: The True Light
There*p was a man sent from God, whose name was*i John.
This man came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all through him might believe.
He was not that Light, but was*i sent*i to bear witness of that Light.
That was the true Light which gives light to every man coming into the world.
He*p was in the world, and the world was made through Him, and the world did not know Him.
He came to His own, and His own did not receive Him.
But as many as received Him, to them He gave the right to become children of God, to those who believe in His name:
who were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
The Word Becomes Flesh
And*p the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we beheld His glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father, full of grace and truth.
John*p bore witness of Him and cried out, saying, “This was He of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me is preferred before me, for He was before me.’”
And*p of His fullness we have all received, and grace for grace.
For the law was given through Moses, but*i grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
No one has seen God at any time. The only begotten Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, He has declared Him.*i
A Voice in the Wilderness
Now*p this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
He*p confessed, and did not deny, but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”
And*p they asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” He*p said, “I am not.” “Are*p you the Prophet?” And*p he answered, “No.”
Then*p they said to him, “Who are you, that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself?”
He*p said: “I am*i ‘The*pn voice of one crying in the wilderness: “Make*ld straight the way of the Lord,”’*sb as*p the prophet Isaiah said.”
Now*p those who were sent were from the Pharisees.
And they asked him, saying, “Why then do you baptize if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
John*p answered them, saying, “I baptize with water, but there stands One among you whom you do not know.
It is He who, coming after me, is preferred before me, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to loose.”
These*p things were done in Bethabara beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
The Lamb of God
The*p next day John saw Jesus coming toward him, and said, “Behold! The Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
This is He of whom I said, ‘After me comes a Man who is preferred before me, for He was before me.’
I did not know Him; but that He should be revealed to Israel, therefore I came baptizing with water.”
And*p John bore witness, saying, “I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and He remained upon Him.
I did not know Him, but He who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘Upon whom you see the Spirit descending, and remaining on Him, this is He who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
And I have seen and testified that this is the Son of God.”
The First Disciples
Again,*p the next day, John stood with two of his disciples.
And looking at Jesus as He walked, he said, “Behold the Lamb of God!”
The*p two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
Then Jesus turned, and seeing them following, said to them, “What*r do*r you*r seek?”*r They*p said to Him, “Rabbi” (which is to say, when translated, Teacher), “where are You staying?”
He*p said to them, “Come*r and*r see.”*r They came and saw where He was staying, and remained with Him that day (now it was about the tenth hour).
One*p of the two who heard John speak,*i and followed Him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
He first found his own brother Simon, and said to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which is translated, the Christ).
And he brought him to Jesus. Now*p when Jesus looked at him, He said, “You*r are*r Simon*r the*r son*r of*r Jonah.*r You*r shall*r be*r called*r Cephas”*r (which is translated, A Stone).
Philip and Nathanael
The*p following day Jesus wanted to go to Galilee, and He found Philip and said to him, “Follow*r Me.”*r
Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found Him of whom Moses in the law, and also the prophets, wrote—Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
And*p Nathanael said to him, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?” Philip*p said to him, “Come and see.”
Jesus*p saw Nathanael coming toward Him, and said of him, “Behold,*r an*r Israelite*r indeed,*r in*r whom*r is*r no*r deceit!”*r
Nathanael*p said to Him, “How do You know me?” Jesus*p answered and said to him, “Before*r Philip*r called*r you,*r when*r you*r were*r under*r the*r fig*r tree,*r I*r saw*r you.”*r
Nathanael*p answered and said to Him, “Rabbi, You are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”
Jesus*p answered and said to him, “Because*r I*r said*r to*r you,*r ‘I*r saw*r you*r under*r the*r fig*r tree,’*r do*r you*r believe?*r You*r will*r see*r greater*r things*r than*r these.”*r

And He said to him, “Most*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r hereafter*r you*r shall*r see*r heaven*r open,*r and*r the*r angels*r of*r God*r ascending*r and*r descending*r upon*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.”*r
John 2
Water Turned to Wine
On*p the third day there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there.
Now both Jesus and His disciples were invited to the wedding.
And when they ran out of wine, the mother of Jesus said to Him, “They have no wine.”
Jesus*p said to her, “Woman,*r what*r does*r your*r concern*r have*r to*r do*r with*r Me?*r My*r hour*r has*r not*r yet*r come.”*r
His*p mother said to the servants, “Whatever He says to you, do it.”*i
Now*p there were set there six waterpots of stone, according to the manner of purification of the Jews, containing twenty or thirty gallons apiece.
Jesus said to them, “Fill*r the*r waterpots*r with*r water.”*r And they filled them up to the brim.
And He said to them, “Draw*r some*ir out*r now,*r and*r take*r it*ir to*r the*r master*r of*r the*r feast.”*r And they took it.*i

When the master of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and did not know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the master of the feast called the bridegroom.
And he said to him, “Every man at the beginning sets out the good wine, and when the guests*i have well drunk, then the inferior. You have kept the good wine until now!”
This*p beginning of signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and manifested His glory; and His disciples believed in Him.
After*p this He went down to Capernaum, He, His mother, His brothers, and His disciples; and they did not stay there many days.
Jesus Cleanses the Temple
Now*p the Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
And He found in the temple those who sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers doing business.
When He had made a whip of cords, He drove them all out of the temple, with the sheep and the oxen, and poured out the changers’ money and overturned the tables.
And He said to those who sold doves, “Take*r these*r things*r away!*r Do*r not*r make*r My*r Father’s*r house*r a*r house*r of*r merchandise!”*r
Then His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for Your house has eaten Me up.”
So*p the Jews answered and said to Him, “What sign do You show to us, since You do these things?”
Jesus*p answered and said to them, “Destroy*r this*r temple,*r and*r in*r three*r days*r I*r will*r raise*r it*r up.”*r
Then*p the Jews said, “It has taken forty-six years to build this temple, and will You raise it up in three days?”
But*p He was speaking of the temple of His body.
Therefore, when He had risen from the dead, His disciples remembered that He had said this to them; and they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus had said.
The Discerner of Hearts
Now*p when He was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in His name when they saw the signs which He did.
But Jesus did not commit Himself to them, because He knew all men,*i
and had no need that anyone should testify of man, for He knew what was in man.
John 3
The New Birth
There*p was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.
This man came to Jesus by night and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that You are a teacher come from God; for no one can do these signs that You do unless God is with him.”
Jesus*p answered and said to him, “Most*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r unless*r one*r is*r born*r again,*r he*r cannot*r see*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
Nicodemus*p said to Him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born?”
Jesus*p answered, “Most*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r unless*r one*r is*r born*r of*r water*r and*r the*r Spirit,*r he*r cannot*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
That*r which*r is*r born*r of*r the*r flesh*r is*r flesh,*r and*r that*r which*r is*r born*r of*r the*r Spirit*r is*r spirit.*r
Do*r not*r marvel*r that*r I*r said*r to*r you,*r ‘You*r must*r be*r born*r again.’*r

Jesus*p answered and said to him, “Are*r you*r the*r teacher*r of*r Israel,*r and*r do*r not*r know*r these*r things?*r
Most*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r We*r speak*r what*r We*r know*r and*r testify*r what*r We*r have*r seen,*r and*r you*r do*r not*r receive*r Our*r witness.*r
If*r I*r have*r told*r you*r earthly*r things*r and*r you*r do*r not*r believe,*r how*r will*r you*r believe*r if*r I*r tell*r you*r heavenly*r things?*r
No*r one*r has*r ascended*r to*r heaven*r but*r He*r who*r came*r down*r from*r heaven,*r that*ir is,*ir the*r Son*r of*r Man*r who*r is*r in*r heaven.*r
And*r as*r Moses*r lifted*r up*r the*r serpent*r in*r the*r wilderness,*r even*r so*r must*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r be*r lifted*r up,*r
that*r whoever*r believes*r in*r Him*r should*r not*r perish*r but*r have*r eternal*r life.*r
For*r God*r so*r loved*r the*r world*r that*r He*r gave*r His*r only*r begotten*r Son,*r that*r whoever*r believes*r in*r Him*r should*r not*r perish*r but*r have*r everlasting*r life.*r
For*r God*r did*r not*r send*r His*r Son*r into*r the*r world*r to*r condemn*r the*r world,*r but*r that*r the*r world*r through*r Him*r might*r be*r saved.*r

“He*rp who*r believes*r in*r Him*r is*r not*r condemned;*r but*r he*r who*r does*r not*r believe*r is*r condemned*r already,*r because*r he*r has*r not*r believed*r in*r the*r name*r of*r the*r only*r begotten*r Son*r of*r God.*r
And*r this*r is*r the*r condemnation,*r that*r the*r light*r has*r come*r into*r the*r world,*r and*r men*r loved*r darkness*r rather*r than*r light,*r because*r their*r deeds*r were*r evil.*r
For*r everyone*r practicing*r evil*r hates*r the*r light*r and*r does*r not*r come*r to*r the*r light,*r lest*r his*r deeds*r should*r be*r exposed.*r
But*r he*r who*r does*r the*r truth*r comes*r to*r the*r light,*r that*r his*r deeds*r may*r be*r clearly*r seen,*r that*r they*r have*r been*r done*r in*r God.”*r
John the Baptist Exalts Christ
After*p these things Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea, and there He remained with them and baptized.
Now John also was baptizing in Aenon near Salim, because there was much water there. And they came and were baptized.
For John had not yet been thrown into prison.
Then*p there arose a dispute between some*i of John’s disciples and the Jews about purification.
And they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, He who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified—behold, He is baptizing, and all are coming to Him!”
John*p answered and said, “A man can receive nothing unless it has been given to him from heaven.
You yourselves bear me witness, that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent before Him.’
He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. Therefore this joy of mine is fulfilled.
He must increase, but I must*i decrease.
He who comes from above is above all; he who is of the earth is earthly and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.
And what He has seen and heard, that He testifies; and no one receives His testimony.
He who has received His testimony has certified that God is true.
For He whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for God does not give the Spirit by measure.
The Father loves the Son, and has given all things into His hand.
He who believes in the Son has everlasting life; and he who does not believe the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God abides on him.”
John 4
A Samaritan Woman Meets Her Messiah
Therefore,*p when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John
(though Jesus Himself did not baptize, but His disciples),
He left Judea and departed again to Galilee.
But He needed to go through Samaria.
So*p He came to a city of Samaria which is called Sychar, near the plot of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
Now Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied from His*i journey, sat thus by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
A*p woman of Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give*r Me*r a*r drink.”*r
For His disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.
Then*p the woman of Samaria said to Him, “How is it that You, being a Jew, ask a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?” For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.

Jesus*p answered and said to her, “If*r you*r knew*r the*r gift*r of*r God,*r and*r who*r it*r is*r who*r says*r to*r you,*r ‘Give*r Me*r a*r drink,’*r you*r would*r have*r asked*r Him,*r and*r He*r would*r have*r given*r you*r living*r water.”*r
The*p woman said to Him, “Sir, You have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. Where then do You get that living water?
Are You greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank from it himself, as well as his sons and his livestock?”
Jesus*p answered and said to her, “Whoever*r drinks*r of*r this*r water*r will*r thirst*r again,*r

but*r whoever*r drinks*r of*r the*r water*r that*r I*r shall*r give*r him*r will*r never*r thirst.*r But*r the*r water*r that*r I*r shall*r give*r him*r will*r become*r in*r him*r a*r fountain*r of*r water*r springing*r up*r into*r everlasting*r life.”*r
The*p woman said to Him, “Sir, give me this water, that I may not thirst, nor come here to draw.”
Jesus*p said to her, “Go,*r call*r your*r husband,*r and*r come*r here.”*r
The*p woman answered and said, “I have no husband.” Jesus*p said to her, “You*r have*r well*r said,*r ‘I*r have*r no*r husband,’*r
for*r you*r have*r had*r five*r husbands,*r and*r the*r one*r whom*r you*r now*r have*r is*r not*r your*r husband;*r in*r that*r you*r spoke*r truly.”*r
The*p woman said to Him, “Sir, I perceive that You are a prophet.
Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and you Jews*i say that in Jerusalem is the place where one ought to worship.”
Jesus*p said to her, “Woman,*r believe*r Me,*r the*r hour*r is*r coming*r when*r you*r will*r neither*r on*r this*r mountain,*r nor*r in*r Jerusalem,*r worship*r the*r Father.*r
You*r worship*r what*r you*r do*r not*r know;*r we*r know*r what*r we*r worship,*r for*r salvation*r is*r of*r the*r Jews.*r

But*r the*r hour*r is*r coming,*r and*r now*r is,*r when*r the*r true*r worshipers*r will*r worship*r the*r Father*r in*r spirit*r and*r truth;*r for*r the*r Father*r is*r seeking*r such*r to*r worship*r Him.*r
God*r is*ir Spirit,*r and*r those*r who*r worship*r Him*r must*r worship*r in*r spirit*r and*r truth.”*r
The*p woman said to Him, “I know that Messiah is coming” (who is called Christ). “When He comes, He will tell us all things.”

The Whitened Harvest
And*p at this point*i His disciples came, and they marveled that He talked with a woman; yet no one said, “What do You seek?” or, “Why are You talking with her?”
The*p woman then left her waterpot, went her way into the city, and said to the men,
“Come, see a Man who told me all things that I ever did. Could this be the Christ?”
Then they went out of the city and came to Him.
In*p the meantime His disciples urged Him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.”
But*p He said to them, “I*r have*r food*r to*r eat*r of*r which*r you*r do*r not*r know.”*r

The Savior of the World
And*p many of the Samaritans of that city believed in Him because of the word of the woman who testified, “He told me all that I ever*i did.”
So when the Samaritans had come to Him, they urged Him to stay with them; and He stayed there two days.
And many more believed because of His own word.
Then*p they said to the woman, “Now we believe, not because of what you said, for we ourselves have heard Him*i and we know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.”
Welcome at Galilee
Now*p after the two days He departed from there and went to Galilee.
For Jesus Himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.
So when He came to Galilee, the Galileans received Him, having seen all the things He did in Jerusalem at the feast; for they also had gone to the feast.
A Nobleman’s Son Healed
So*p Jesus came again to Cana of Galilee where He had made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman whose son was sick at Capernaum.
When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to Him and implored Him to come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.
Then Jesus said to him, “Unless*r you*r people*ir see*r signs*r and*r wonders,*r you*r will*r by*r no*r means*r believe.”*r
The*p nobleman said to Him, “Sir, come down before my child dies!”
Jesus*p said to him, “Go*r your*r way;*r your*r son*r lives.”*r So the man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way.
And as he was now going down, his servants met him and told him,*i saying, “Your son lives!”
Then*p he inquired of them the hour when he got better. And they said to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”
So the father knew that it*i was*i at the same hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your*r son*r lives.”*r And he himself believed, and his whole household.
This*p again is*i the second sign Jesus did when He had come out of Judea into Galilee.
John 5
A Man Healed at the Pool of Bethesda
After*p this there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
Now there is in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate*i a pool, which is called in Hebrew, Bethesda, having five porches.
In these lay a great multitude of sick people, blind, lame, paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water.
For an angel went down at a certain time into the pool and stirred up the water; then whoever stepped in first, after the stirring of the water, was made well of whatever disease he had.
Now a certain man was there who had an infirmity thirty-eight years.
When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he already had been in*i that*i condition*i a long time, He said to him, “Do*r you*r want*r to*r be*r made*r well?”*r
The*p sick man answered Him, “Sir, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up; but while I am coming, another steps down before me.”
Jesus*p said to him, “Rise,*r take*r up*r your*r bed*r and*r walk.”*r

He*p answered them, “He who made me well said to me, ‘Take*r up*r your*r bed*r and*r walk.’”*r

Honor the Father and the Son
For*p this reason the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill Him, because He had done these things on the Sabbath.
But Jesus answered them, “My*r Father*r has*r been*r working*r until*r now,*r and*r I*r have*r been*r working.”*r
Therefore*p the Jews sought all the more to kill Him, because He not only broke the Sabbath, but also said that God was His Father, making Himself equal with God.

Then Jesus answered and said to them, “Most*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r the*r Son*r can*r do*r nothing*r of*r Himself,*r but*r what*r He*r sees*r the*r Father*r do;*r for*r whatever*r He*r does,*r the*r Son*r also*r does*r in*r like*r manner.*r

that*r all*r should*r honor*r the*r Son*r just*r as*r they*r honor*r the*r Father.*r He*r who*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Son*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r Him.*r
